Seneca
  • API
  • Docs
  • FAQ
  • Plugins
  • Roadmap
  • Support

§Plugins

Seneca plugins enable you to build awesome microservices, incredibly fast. Some plugins are maintained in-house, while others are provided by the community.

On this page, we provide an npm link and total downloads per month for any plugins we find or publish ourselves, so you only need to look in one place.

§Group name: cache

Group description: cache. This will be a longer description eventually, giving background on what this family of plugins could be used for, and how to use them. Terminology should be decided between group/family/clan/etc

§Group name: provider

Group description: provider. This will be a longer description eventually, giving background on what this family of plugins could be used for, and how to use them. Terminology should be decided between group/family/clan/etc

  • apimatic-provider
    • Provides access to the Tangocard API using the Seneca provider convention. Tangocard API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.. This will be a short description taken from the package.json file.
  • branchio-provider
    • Provides access to the Branchio API using the Seneca provider convention. Branchio API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.. This will be a short description taken from the package.json file.
  • checklyhq-provider
    • Provides access to the Checkly API using the Seneca provider convention. Checkly API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.. This will be a short description taken from the package.json file.
  • eventbrite-provider
    • Seneca provider for the eventbrite.com API. . This will be a short description taken from the package.json file.
  • evervault-provider
    • Provides access to the Evervault API using the Seneca provider convention. Evervault API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.. This will be a short description taken from the package.json file.
  • gcal-provider
    • Seneca plugin that provides access to the Google Calendar API.. This will be a short description taken from the package.json file.
  • github-provider
    • Provides access to the Github API using the Seneca provider convention. Github API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.. This will be a short description taken from the package.json file.
  • gitlab-provider
    • Provides access to the Gitlab API using the Seneca provider convention. Gitlab API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.. This will be a short description taken from the package.json file.
  • hubspot-provider
    • Provides access to the Hubspot API using the Seneca provider convention. Hubspot API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.. This will be a short description taken from the package.json file.
  • meetup-provider
    • Provides access to the Meetup API using the Seneca provider convention. Meetup API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.. This will be a short description taken from the package.json file.
  • mixpanel-provider
    • Provides access to the Mixpanel API using the Seneca provider convention. Mixpanel API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.. This will be a short description taken from the package.json file.
  • nordigen-provider
    • Provides access to the Nordigen API using the Seneca provider convention. Nordigen API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.. This will be a short description taken from the package.json file.
  • notion-provider
    • Provides access to the Notion API using the Seneca provider convention. Notion API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.. This will be a short description taken from the package.json file.
  • orbit-provider
    • Provides access to the Orbit API using the Seneca provider convention. Orbit API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.. This will be a short description taken from the package.json file.
  • salesforce-provider
    • Seneca plugin that provides access to the SalesForce API. . This will be a short description taken from the package.json file.
  • stytch-provider
    • Provides access to the Stytch API using the Seneca provider convention. Stytch API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.. This will be a short description taken from the package.json file.
  • tangocard-provider
    • Provides access to the Tangocard API using the Seneca provider convention. Tangocard API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.. This will be a short description taken from the package.json file.
  • trello-provider
    • Provides access to the Trello API using the Seneca provider convention. Trello API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.. This will be a short description taken from the package.json file.
  • vercel-provider
    • Provides access to the Vercel API using the Seneca provider convention. Vercel API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.. This will be a short description taken from the package.json file.
  • webflow-provider
    • Provides access to the Webflow CMS API using the Seneca provider convention. Webflow CMS API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.. This will be a short description taken from the package.json file.
  • zoom-provider
    • Seneca plugin that provides access to the Zoom API. . This will be a short description taken from the package.json file.
  • customerio-provider
    • Seneca plugin that provides access to the customer.io API. . This will be a short description taken from the package.json file.

Provides access to the Meetup API using the Seneca provider convention. Meetup API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages. This will be a short description taken from the package.json file.

§apimatic-provider

Provides access to the Tangocard API using the Seneca provider convention. Tangocard API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.

Provides access to the Branchio API using the Seneca provider convention. Branchio API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.

§eventbrite-provider

Seneca provider for the eventbrite.com API.

§evervault-provider

Provides access to the Evervault API using the Seneca provider convention. Evervault API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.

§gcal-provider

§Got a plugin to share?

Our docs are open source. Simply fork the senecajs.org repository, add your plugin to the appropriate section, and send us on a pull request - that way, other people can find your awesome plugin easily.

Issues? From spelling errors to broken tutorials and everything in between, report them here.

Documentation

Twitter
